content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long string that should be wrapped to fit within the text width."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output something like:

```
This is a very
long string that
should be wrapped to
fit within the text
width.
```
